description: • Project sponsored and Guided by Veritas.
• Predictive coding and technology-assisted review (TAR). Manual reviews of millions of documents are extremely costly, time-consuming, error-prone, full of biases/prejudices.

• Proposed solution: Implement supervised rule-based machine learning algorithms to “train” the system so that it can “predict” potential matches. Let manual reviewers, review only a handful of documents (say 100), train the system based on that samples, and let the system predict matching documents from millions of documents.
• Worked on technologies: Python, classification algorithms, NLP.
• Completed and deployed a Supply Chain Management project.

• This project manages multiple tasks for farmers, suppliers, sellers and buyers. It solves existing problem of backtracking if any error is found in the product. My role was to implement permission and approval system of the software.
• Worked on technologies: Django REST and MySQL.
• Worked on a project that automates the manual process of downloading data from various public APIs and represented that data in a statistical and structured way on a website.
• Worked on technologies: Python and JavaScript.

volunteer.heading: PICT IEEE Student Branch
description: Technical Head at PICT IEEE Student Branch(PISB) contains more than 300+ active student members in it
• Organised Tech Fest (Credenz '19) in the college
• Took SIGs and technical talks for students.
• Help to increase technical activities in student branch.
